words.def: absolute zero - a theoretical condition concerning a system at zero Kelvin where a system does not emit or absorb energy (all atoms are at rest)
words.name: absolute zero

words.def: absorbance -
words.name: absorbance

words.def: accuracy - how close a value is to the actual or true value; also see precision
words.name: accuracy

words.def: acid - a compound that, when dissolved in water, gives a pH of less than 7.0 or a compound that donates a hydrogen ion
words.name: acid

words.def: acid anhydride - a compound with two acyl groups bound to a single oxygen atom
words.name: acid anhydride

words.def: acid dissociation constant - an equilibrium constant for the dissociation of a weak acid
words.name: acid dissociation constant

words.def: actinides - the fifteen chemical elements that are between actinium (89) and lawrencium (103)
words.name: actinides

words.def: activated complex - a structure that forms because of a collision between molecules while new bonds are formed
words.name: activated complex

words.def: activation energy - the minimum energy that must be input to a chemical system
words.name: activation energy

words.def: addition reaction - within organic chemistry, when two or more molecules combine to make a larger one
words.name: addition reaction

words.def: adhesion -
words.name: adhesion

words.def: aeration - the mixing of air into a liquid or solid
words.name: aeration

words.def: alcohol -
words.name: alcohol

words.def: aldehyde -
words.name: aldehyde

words.def: alkali metals - the metals of Group 1 on the periodic table
words.name: alkali metals

words.def: alkaline earth metals - the metals of Group 2 on the periodic table
words.name: alkaline earth metals

words.def: alkane -
words.name: alkane

words.def: alkene -
words.name: alkene

words.def: alkyl group -
words.name: alkyl group

words.def: alkyne -
words.name: alkyne

words.def: allomer - a substance that has different composition than another, but has the same crystalline structure
words.name: allomer

words.def: allotropy - elements that can have different structures (and therefore different forms), such as Carbon (diamonds, graphite, and fullerene)
words.name: allotropy

words.def: amplitude - the maximum distance that the particles of the medium carrying the wave move away from their rest position
words.name: amplitude

words.def: anion - negatively charge ions
words.name: anion

words.def: anode - the positive side of a dry cell battery or a cell
words.name: anode

words.def: aromaticity - chemical property of conjugated rings that results in unusual stability. See also benzene.
words.name: aromaticity

words.def: atom - a chemical element in its smallest form, and is made up of neutrons and protons within the nucleus and electrons circling the nucleus
words.name: atom

words.def: atomic number - the number representing an element which corresponds with the number of protons within the nucleus
words.name: atomic number

words.def: atomic orbital - the region where the electron of the atom may be found
words.name: atomic orbital

words.def: Avogadro's number - is the number of particles in a mole of a substance ( 6.02x10^23 )
words.name: Avogadro's number

words.def: barometer - a device used to measure the pressure in the atmosphere
words.name: barometer

words.def: base - a substance that accepts a proton and has a high pH; a common example is sodium hydroxide (NaOH)
words.name: base

words.def: base anhydride - oxides of group I and II metal elements
words.name: base anhydride

words.def: beat - a slow oscillation in amplitude of a complex wave
words.name: beat

words.def: Beer-Lambert law -
words.name: Beer-Lambert law

words.def: biochemistry - the chemistry of organisms
words.name: biochemistry

words.def: Bohr model -
words.name: Bohr model

words.def: boiling - the phase transition of liquid vaporizing
words.name: boiling

words.def: boiling point - the temperature in which the substance starts to boil
words.name: boiling point

words.def: boiling-point elevation - the process where the boiling point is elevated by adding a substance
words.name: boiling-point elevation

words.def: bond - the attraction and repulsion between atoms and molecules that is a cornerstone of chemistry
words.name: bond

words.def: Boyle's law - for a given mass of gas at constant temperature, the volume varies inversely with the pressure
words.name: Boyle's law

words.def: Bragg's law -
words.name: Bragg's law

words.def: Brønsted-Lowrey acid - A chemical species that donates a proton
words.name: Brønsted-Lowrey acid

words.def: Brønsted–Lowry acid–base reaction -
words.name: Brønsted–Lowry acid–base reaction

words.def: Brønsted-Lowrey base - A chemical species that accepts a proton
words.name: Brønsted-Lowrey base

words.def: buckminsterfullerene -
words.name: buckminsterfullerene

words.def: buffered solution - An aqueous solution consisting of a weak acid and its conjugate base or a weak base and its conjugate acid that resists changes in pH when strong acids or bases are added
words.name: buffered solution

words.def: bumping -
words.name: bumping

words.def: burette (also buret) - glassware used to dispense specific amounts of liquid when precision is necessary (e.g. titration and resource dependent reactions)
words.name: burette

words.def: calorimeter -
words.name: calorimeter

words.def: catalyst - a chemical compound used to change the rate (either to speed up or slow down) of a reaction, but is regenerated at the end of the reaction.
words.name: catalyst

words.def: cation - positively charged ion
words.name: cation

words.def: centrifugation -
words.name: centrifugation

words.def: centrifuge - equipment used to separate substances based on density by rotating the tubes around a centred axis
words.name: centrifuge

words.def: cell potential - the force in a galvanic cell that pulls electron through reducing agent to oxidizing agent
words.name: cell potential

words.def: chain reaction -
words.name: chain reaction

words.def: Charles's law -
words.name: Charles's law

words.def: chelation -
words.name: chelation

words.def: chemical formula -
words.name: chemical formula

words.def: chemical law - certain rules that pertain to the laws of nature and chemistry - examples
words.name: chemical law

words.def: chemical reaction - the change of one or more substances into another or multiple substances
words.name: chemical reaction

words.def: closed system -
words.name: closed system

words.def: colligative properties -
words.name: colligative properties

words.def: colloid - mixture of evenly dispersed substances, such as many milks
words.name: colloid

words.def: combustion - an exothermic reaction between an oxidant and fuel with heat and often light
words.name: combustion

words.def: compression - an area in a longitudinal wave where the particles are closer and pushed in
words.name: compression

words.def: compound - a substance that is made up of two or more chemically bonded elements
words.name: compound

words.def: condensation - the phase change from gas to liquid
words.name: condensation

words.def: conductor - material that allows electric flow more freely
words.name: conductor

words.def: conjugate acid -
words.name: conjugate acid

words.def: conjugated system -
words.name: conjugated system

words.def: cooling curve -
words.name: cooling curve

words.def: covalent bond - chemical bond that involves sharing electrons
words.name: covalent bond

words.def: crest - the highest point in a wave
words.name: crest

words.def: crystal - a solid that is packed with ions, molecules or atoms in an orderly fashion
words.name: crystal

words.def: cuvette - glassware used in spectroscopic experiments. It is usually made of plastic, glass or quartz and should be as clean and clear as possible
words.name: cuvette

words.def: Dalton's law of partial pressures -
words.name: Dalton's law of partial pressures

words.def: deionization - the removal of ions, and in water's case mineral ions such as sodium, iron and calcium
words.name: deionization

words.def: deliquescence - substances that absorb water from the atmosphere to form liquid solutions
words.name: deliquescence

words.def: density - The amount of mass per unit volume. d = m/V
words.name: density

words.def: deposition - settling of particles within a solution or mixture
words.name: deposition

words.def: diffusion -
words.name: diffusion

words.def: dipolar bond -
words.name: dipolar bond

words.def: dipole - electric or magnetic separation of charge
words.name: dipole

words.def: dipole moment - the polarity of a polar covalent bond
words.name: dipole moment

words.def: dissolution or solvation - the spread of ions in a monosaccharide
words.name: dissolution or solvation

words.def: double bond - sharing of two pairs of electrons (in a covalent bond)
words.name: double bond

words.def: diatomic-consistent of two atoms
words.name: diatomic

words.def: earth metal - see alkaline earth metal
words.name: earth metal

words.def: electrochemical cell - using a chemical reaction's current, electromotive force is made
words.name: electrochemical cell

words.def: electromagnetic radiation - a type of wave that can go through vacuums as well as material and classified as a self-propagating wave
words.name: electromagnetic radiation

words.def: electromagnetism - fields that have electric charge and electric properties that change the way that particles move and interact
words.name: electromagnetism

words.def: electromotive force - a device that gains energy as electric charges pass through it
words.name: electromotive force

words.def: electron - a subatomic particle with a net charge that is negative
words.name: electron

words.def: electron shells - an orbital around the atom's nucleus that has a fixed number electrons (usually two or eight)
words.name: electron shells

words.def: electric charge - a measured property (coulombs) that determine electromagnetic interaction
words.name: electric charge

words.def: element - an atom that is defined by its atomic number
words.name: element

words.def: energy - A system's ability to do work
words.name: energy

words.def: enthalpy - measure of the total energy of a thermodynamic system (usually symbolized as H)
words.name: enthalpy

words.def: entropy - the amount of energy not available for work in a closed thermodynamic system (usually symbolized as S)
words.name: entropy

words.def: enzyme - a protein that speeds up (catalyses) a reaction
words.name: enzyme

words.def: Empirical Formula - also called the simplest formula, gives the simplest whole -number ratio of atoms of each element present in a compound.
words.name: Empirical Formula

words.def: eppendorf tube - generalized and trademarked term used for a type of tube; see microcentrifuge
words.name: eppendorf tube

words.def: exothermic process -
words.name: exothermic process

words.def: extrinsic property -
words.name: extrinsic property

words.def: freezing - phase transition from liquid to solid
words.name: freezing

words.def: Faraday constant - a unit of electrical charge widely used in electrochemistry and equal to ~ 96,500 coulombs.
words.name: Faraday constant

words.def:
Faraday's law of electrolysis - a two part law that Michael Faraday published about electrolysis

the mass of a substance altered at an electrode during electrolysis is directly proportional to the quantity of electricity transferred at that electrode
the mass of an elemental material altered at an electrode is directly proportional to the element's equivalent weight.
words.name: Faraday's law of electrolysis

words.def: Fick's laws of diffusion -
words.name: Fick's laws of diffusion

words.def: frequency - number of cycles per unit of time. Unit: 1 hertz = 1 cycle per 1 second
words.name: frequency

words.def: Galvanic cell - battery made up of electrochemical with two different metals connected by salt bridge
words.name: Galvanic cell

words.def: gas - particles that fill their container though have no definite shape or volume
words.name: gas

words.def: Gay-Lussac's Law - The expression Gay-Lussac's law is used for each of the two relationships named after the French chemist Joseph Louis Gay-Lussac and which concern the properties of gases, though it is more usually applied to his law of combining volumes
words.name: Gay-Lussac's Law

words.def: geochemistry - the chemistry of and chemical composition of the Earth
words.name: geochemistry

words.def: Gibbs energy - value that indicates the spontaneity of a reaction (usually symbolized as G)
words.name: Gibbs energy

words.def: group - the elements in a column of the periodic table. A family of elements
words.name: group

words.def: halogens - Group 17 on the Periodic Table and are all non-metals
words.name: halogens

words.def: heat - energy transferred from one system to another by thermal interaction
words.name: heat

words.def: Henry's law -
words.name: Henry's law

words.def: Hess's law -
words.name: Hess's law

words.def: Hund's rules -
words.name: Hund's rules

words.def: ideal gas -
words.name: ideal gas

words.def: ideal gas law - the volume of a gas is proportional to the amount of gas and its Kelvin temperature and inversely proportional to its pressure
words.name: ideal gas law

words.def: indicator - a special compound added to solution that changes color depending on the acidity of the solution; different indicators have different colors and effective pH ranges
words.name: indicator

words.def: induced radioactivity - radioactivity caused by bombarding a stable isotope with elemental particles, forming a radioactive isotope
words.name: induced radioactivity

words.def: inorganic compound - compounds that do not contain carbon, though there are exceptions (see main article)
words.name: inorganic compound

words.def: inorganic chemistry - a part of chemistry concerned with inorganic compounds
words.name: inorganic chemistry

words.def: IUPAC - International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry
words.name: IUPAC

words.def: insulator - material that resists the flow of electric current
words.name: insulator

words.def: intrinsic property -
words.name: intrinsic property

words.def: ion - a molecule that has gained or lost one or more electrons
words.name: ion

words.def: ionic bond - electrostatic attraction between oppositely charged ions
words.name: ionic bond

words.def: ionization -The breaking up of a compound into separate ions.
words.name: ionization

words.def: jodium – Latin name of the halogen element iodine[citation needed]
words.name: jodium

words.def: Joule - The SI unit of energy, defined as a newton-meter.
words.name: Joule

words.def: kelvin - A unit of measure for temperature based upon an absolute scale.
words.name: kelvin

words.def: ketone - an organic compound with a carbonyl group between two carbon atoms
words.name: ketone

words.def: Kinetics - A sub-field of chemistry specializing in reaction rates
words.name: Kinetics

words.def: Kinetic energy - The energy of an object due to its motion.
words.name: Kinetic energy

words.def: lanthanides - Elements 57 through 71
words.name: lanthanides

words.def: lattice - Unique arrangement of atoms or molecules in a crystalline liquid or solid.
words.name: lattice

words.def: Lewis acid -
words.name: Lewis acid

words.def: Lewis base -
words.name: Lewis base

words.def: liquid - A state of matter in which cohesive force is less than or equal to the separating force.
words.name: liquid

words.def: light - Portion of the electromagnetic spectrum which is visible to the naked eye. Also called "visible light."
words.name: light

words.def: London dispersion forces - A weak intermolecular force
words.name: London dispersion forces

words.def: laws of motion - An object in motion stays in motion; an object at rest stays at rest unless an unbalanced force acts on it.
words.name: laws of motion

words.def: magnetic quantum number -
words.name: magnetic quantum number

words.def: manometer -
words.name: manometer

words.def: mass -
words.name: mass

words.def: mass concentration -
words.name: mass concentration

words.def: mass fraction -
words.name: mass fraction

words.def: metal - Chemical element that is a good conductor of both electricity and heat and forms cations and ionic bonds with non-metals.
words.name: metal

words.def: melting - The phase change from a solid to a liquid
words.name: melting

words.def: metalloid - A substance possessing both the properties of metals and non-metals
words.name: metalloid

words.def: methylene blue - a heterocyclic aromatic chemical compound with the molecular formula C16H18N3SCl
words.name: methylene blue

words.def: microcentrifuge - a small plastic container that is used to store small amounts of liquid
words.name: microcentrifuge

words.def: molar attenuation coefficient -
words.name: molar attenuation coefficient

words.def: molar mass -
words.name: molar mass

words.def:
mole - abbreviated mol - a measurement of an amount of substance; a single mole contains approximately 6.022×1023 units or entities

a mole of water contains 6.022×1023 H2O molecules
words.name: mole

words.def: molecular formula -
words.name: molecular formula

words.def: molecular orbital - region where an electron can be found in a molecule (as opposed to an atom)
words.name: molecular orbital

words.def: molecular orbital diagram -
words.name: molecular orbital diagram

words.def: molecule - a chemically bonded number of atoms that are electrically neutral
words.name: molecule

words.def: neat - conditions with a liquid reagent or gas performed with no added solvent or cosolvent
words.name: neat

words.def: neutron - a neutral unit or subatomic particle that has no net charge
words.name: neutron

words.def: neutrino - a particle that can travel at speeds close to the speed of light and are created as a result of radioactive decay
words.name: neutrino

words.def: nucleus - the centre of an atom made up of neutrons and protons, with a net positive charge
words.name: nucleus

words.def: noble gases - group 18 elements, those whose outer electron shell is filled
words.name: noble gases

words.def: non-metal - an element which is not metallic
words.name: non-metal

words.def: nuclear - of or pertaining to the atomic nucleus
words.name: nuclear

words.def: nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy - technique that exploits the magnetic properties of certain nuclei, useful for identifying unknown compounds
words.name: nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy

words.def: number density – a measure of concentration of countable objects (atoms, molecules, etc.) in space; number per volume
words.name: number density

words.def: orbital - may refer to either an atomic orbital or a molecular orbital
words.name: orbital

words.def: organic compound - compounds that contain carbon
words.name: organic compound

words.def: organic chemistry - a part of chemistry concerned with organic compounds
words.name: organic chemistry

words.def: organic redox reaction -
words.name: organic redox reaction

words.def: oxidation -
words.name: oxidation

words.def: oxidation state -
words.name: oxidation state

words.def: oxidizing agent -
words.name: oxidizing agent

words.def: pH - the measure of acidity (or basicity) of a solution
words.name: pH

words.def: plasma - state of matter similar to gas in which a certain portion of the particles are ionized
words.name: plasma

words.def: other metal - metallic elements in the p-block, characterized by having a combination of relatively low melting points (all less than 950 K) and relatively high electronegativity values (all more than 1.6, revised Pauling)
words.name: other metal

words.def: potential energy - energy stored in a body or in a system due to its position in a force field or due to its configuration
words.name: potential energy

words.def: precipitate - formation of a solid in a solution or inside another solid during a chemical reaction or by diffusion in a solid
words.name: precipitate

words.def: precision - How close the results of multiple experimental trials are. See also accuracy.
words.name: precision

words.def: photon - a carrier of electromagnetic radiation of all wavelength (such as gamma rays and radio waves)
words.name: photon

words.def: proton - a positive unit or subatomic particle that has a positive charge
words.name: proton

words.def: protonation - the addition of a proton (H+) to an atom, molecule, or ion
words.name: protonation

words.def: Quantum mechanics - the study of how atoms, molecules, subatomic particles, etc. behave and are structured
words.name: Quantum mechanics

words.def: quarks - elementary particle and a fundamental constituent of matter
words.name: quarks

words.def: quanta- It is the minimum amount of bundle of energy
words.name: quanta

words.def: radiation - energy in the form of waves or subatomic particles when there is a change from high energy to low energy states
words.name: radiation

words.def: radioactive decay - the process of an unstable atomic nucleus losing energy by emitting radiation
words.name: radioactive decay

words.def: Raoult's law -
words.name: Raoult's law

words.def: reactivity series -
words.name: reactivity series

words.def: reagent -
words.name: reagent

words.def: redox -
words.name: redox

words.def: reducing agent -
words.name: reducing agent

words.def: reduction potential -
words.name: reduction potential

words.def: s-block elements - Group 1 and 2 elements (alkali and alkaline metals), which includes Hydrogen and Helium
words.name: s-block elements

words.def: salts - ionic compounds composed of anions and cations
words.name: salts

words.def: salt bridge - devices used to connection reduction with oxidation half-cells in an electrochemical cell
words.name: salt bridge

words.def: saline solution - general term for NaCl in water
words.name: saline solution

words.def: Schrödinger equation - quantum state equation which represents the behaviour of an election around an atom
words.name: Schrödinger equation

words.def: semiconductor - an electrically conductive solid that is between a conductor and an insulator
words.name: semiconductor

words.def: single bond - sharing of one pair of electrons
words.name: single bond

words.def: sol - a suspension of solid particles in liquid. Artificial examples include sol-gels.
words.name: sol

words.def: solid - one of the states of matter, where the molecules are packed close together, there is a resistance of movement/deformation and volume change; see Young's modulus
words.name: solid

words.def: solute - the part of the solution that is mixed into the solvent (NaCl in saline water)
words.name: solute

words.def: solution - homogeneous mixture made up of multiple substances. It is made up of solutes and solvents.
words.name: solution

words.def: solvent - the part of the solution that dissolves the solute (H2O in saline water)
words.name: solvent

words.def: spectrochemistry -
words.name: spectrochemistry

words.def: spectroscopy - study of radiation and matter, such as X-ray absorption and emission spectroscopy
words.name: spectroscopy

words.def: speed of light - the speed of anything that has zero rest mass (Energyrest = mc² where m is the mass and c is the speed of light)
words.name: speed of light

words.def: Standard conditions for temperature and pressure or SATP - a standardisation used in order compare experimental results (25 °C and 100.000 kPa)
words.name: Standard conditions for temperature and pressure

words.def: state of matter - matter having a homogeneous, macroscopic phase; gas, plasma, liquid, and solid are the most well known (in increasing concentration)
words.name: state of matter

words.def: structural formula -
words.name: structural formula

words.def: sublimation - a phase transition from solid to limewater fuel or gas
words.name: sublimation

words.def: subatomic particles - particles that are smaller than an atom; examples are protons, neutrons and electrons
words.name: subatomic particles

words.def: substance - material with definite chemical composition
words.name: substance

words.def: talc - a mineral representing the one on the Mohs Scale and composed of hydrated magnesium silicate with the chemical formula H2Mg3(SiO3)4 or Mg3Si4O10(OH)2
words.name: talc

words.def: temperature - the average energy of microscopic motions of particles
words.name: temperature

words.def: theoretical yield - see yield
words.name: theoretical yield

words.def: theory - a model describing the nature of a phenomenon
words.name: theory
thermal conductivity

words.def: thermochemistry - the study of absorption/release of heat within a chemical reaction
words.name: thermochemistry

words.def: thermodynamics - the study of the effects of changing temperature, volume or pressure (or work, heat, and energy) on a macroscopic scale
words.name: thermodynamics

words.def: thermodynamic stability - when a system is in its lowest energy state with its environment (equilibrium)
words.name: thermodynamic stability

words.def: thermometer - device that measures the average energy of a system
words.name: thermometer

words.def: titration - the process of titrating one solution with another, also called volumetric analysis
words.name: titration

words.def: torr - a unit to measure pressure (1 Torr is equivalent to 133.322 Pa or 1.3158×10−3 atm)
words.name: torr

words.def: transition metal - elements that have incomplete d sub-shells, but also may be referred to as the d-block elements
words.name: transition metal

words.def: transuranic element - element with atomic number greater than 92; none of the transuranic elements are stable
words.name: transuranic element

words.def: triple bond - the sharing of three pairs of electrons within a covalent bond (example N2)
words.name: triple bond

words.def: triple point - the place where temperature and pressure of three phases are the same (Water has a special phase diagram)
words.name: triple point

words.def: Tyndall effect - the effect of light scattering by colloidal (mixture where one substance is dispersed evenly through another) or suspended particles
words.name: Tyndall effect

words.def: UN number - a four digit code used to note hazardous and flammable substances
words.name: UN number

words.def: uncertainty - a characteristic that any measurement that involves estimation of any amount cannot be exactly reproducible
words.name: uncertainty

words.def: Uncertainty principle - knowing the location of a particle makes the momentum uncertain, while knowing the momentum of a particle makes the location uncertain
words.name: Uncertainty principle

words.def: unit cell - the smallest repeating unit of a lattice
words.name: unit cell

words.def: unit factor - statements used in converting between units
words.name: unit factor

words.def: universal or ideal gas constant - proportionality constant in the ideal gas law (0.08206 L·atm/(K·mol))
words.name: universal or ideal gas constant

words.def: valence electron - the outermost electrons of an atom, which are located in electron shells
words.name: valence electron

words.def: Valence bond theory - a theory explaining the chemical bonding within molecules by discussing valencies, the number of chemical bonds formed by an atom
words.name: Valence bond theory

words.def: valency - The combining capacity of an element.
words.name: valency

words.def: van der Waals force - one of the forces (attraction/repulsion) between molecules
words.name: van der Waals force

words.def: van 't Hoff factor - ratio of moles of particles in solution to moles of solute dissolved
words.name: van 't Hoff factor

words.def: vapor - when a substance is below the critical temperature while in the gas phase
words.name: vapor

words.def: vapour pressure - pressure of vapour over a liquid at equilibrium
words.name: vapour pressure

words.def: vaporization - phase change from liquid to gas
words.name: vaporization

words.def: viscosity - the resistance of a liquid to flow (oil)
words.name: viscosity

words.def: volt - one joule of work per coulomb - the unit of electrical potential transferred
words.name: volt

words.def: voltmeter - instrument that measures the cell potential
words.name: voltmeter

words.def: volumetric analysis - see titration
words.name: volumetric analysis

words.def: water - H2O - a chemical substance, a major part of cells and Earth, and covalently bonded
words.name: water

words.def: wave function - a function describing the electron's position in a three-dimensional space
words.name: wave function

words.def: work - the amount of force over distance and is in terms of joules (energy)
words.name: work

words.def: X-ray - form of ionizing, electromagnetic radiation, between gamma and UV rays
words.name: X-ray

words.def: X-ray diffraction - a method for establishing structures of crystalline solids using singe wavelength X-rays and looking at diffraction pattern
words.name: X-ray diffraction

words.def: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy - a spectroscopic technique to measure composition of a material
words.name: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy

words.def: yield - the amount of product produced during a chemical reaction
words.name: yield

words.def: zone melting - a way to remove impurities from an element by melting it and slowly travel down an ingot (cast)
words.name: zone melting

words.def: Zwitterion - is a chemical compound whose net charge is zero and hence is electrically neutral. But there are some positive and negative charges in it, due to the formal charge, owing to the partial charges of its constituent atoms.
words.name: Zwitterion

words.def: zinc-an element or a metal with symbol Zn
words.name: zinc
